```{r include=FALSE,echo=FALSE}
require(tigerstats)
require(tidyverse)
require(leaps)
```

# Predicting Fish Weight
  
```{r}
Perch <- filter(Fish,Species== "Perch")
Perch <- select(Perch, -Species)
```
  
```{r}
PerchModel1<- lm(Weight~.,Perch)
summary(PerchModel1)
```
  
```{r}
PerchModel3<- lm(Weight~. -Length1,Perch)
summary(PerchModel3)
```

```{r}
PerchModel3<- lm(Weight~. -Length1 -Length2,Perch)
summary(PerchModel3)
```  
  
```{r}
PerchModel4<- lm(Weight~. -Length1 -Length2 -Length3,Perch)
summary(PerchModel4)
```
  
```{r}
PerchModel5<- lm(Weight~. -Length1 -Length2 -Length3 -Width,Perch)
summary(PerchModel5)
```

```{r}
regsubsets.out <- regsubsets(Weight~., data=Perch nbest=1, nvmax=NULL, force.in=NULL, forced.out=NULL,
                             method="exhaustive")
summary.out <- summary(regsubsets.out)
```

```{r}
library(leaps)
regsubsets.out <-
regsubsets(Weight ~ .,
data = Perch,
nbest = 1, # 1 best model for each number of predictors
nvmax = NULL, # NULL for no limit on number of variables
force.in = NULL, force.out = NULL,
method = "exhaustive")

summary.out <- summary(regsubsets.out)
as.data.frame(summary.out$outmat)
library(car)
subsets(regsubsets.out,statistic="adjr2",legend="bottom",main="Adjusted R^2")
```
